title: Police: Teenage passenger shot inside vehicle in Syracuse
content:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- A teenager was hospitalized late Saturday night after he was shot while sitting inside a vehicle in Syracuse's Strathmore neighorhood, the Syracuse Police Department announced today.
Police were called to the community campus of Upstate University Hospital off of Broad Road at 11:53 p.m. Saturday for a shooting complaint.
A 17-year-old had been brought to the hospital in a private vehicle after he was shot, police said. He had one gunshot wound to the left side of his torso, according to the department.
The teenager told police he was sitting in the backseat of a vehicle in Syracuse's Strathmore neighborhood along the 1600 block of Bellevue Avenue, between Rider and Reed avenues, when he was shot, police said.
His injuries are not believed to be life-threatening, police said.
Authorities currently do not have a suspect description.
The Syracuse Police Department asks anyone with information to call (315) 442-5222 or submit information using the "SPD Tips" app.
